articles.title: Developped Tools
articles.contents:
mFD R Package and associated tutorials
During my PhD, I have developped the mFD R package which computes and plots functional diversity indices.

It is currently available on CRAN and Github for the development version.
Its website goes with a set of tutorials to help to go through the functional analysis process.
Website on the basics of Code Reproductibility in R
During on a project made during a teaching unit done by the FRB-CESAB in Montpellier (December 2021),
two other PhD students and I have build a website on the basics of Code Reproductibility. Lena Klay, Erwan Harscouet and I hope that this PokeReproductibility website can help newcomers in the Reproductibility to understand the key concepts!

articles.title: Camille Magneville
articles.contents:
Camille Magneville
          
          
          Home
          Research
          Teachings
          Developped Tools
          Scientific Events
          Publications
          CV
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Camille Magneville
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Hi! 👋
            I have been captivated by nature ever since my childhood,
            when I first began exploring the trails of the Alps. The
            complexity of nature is immense, and we have only scratched
            the surface of our understanding of natural ecosystems
            functioning.
            When examining a species community, diversity is often
            measured in terms of species richness, but it can also be
            observed through the lens of species functional strategies,
            known as functional diversity or species phylogenetic
            history, know as phylogenetic diversity.
            The main characteristic of my research so far, is to lead
            a multidimensional approach of diversity, considering not
            only taxonomic diversity but also functional and
            phylogenetic diversities, to study the impact of human
            activity on ecosystems. I’m also interested in developing
            new methodological approaches to better assess ecosystem
            functioning. I have studied different taxa and scales which
            has led me to be more motivated by the research question
            itself rather than by the taxa it applies to.
            I’d love to hear from you, you can find me online using
            the links on the left!
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Camille Magneville
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      Twitter
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      GitHub
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      Email

              I have been captivated by nature ever since my
              childhood, when I first began exploring the trails of the
              Alps. The complexity of nature is immense, and we have
              only scratched the surface of our understanding of natural
              ecosystems functioning.
              When examining a species community, diversity is often
              measured in terms of species richness, but it can also be
              observed through the lens of species functional
              strategies, known as functional diversity or species
              phylogenetic history, know as phylogenetic diversity.
              The main characteristic of my research so far, is to
              lead a multidimensional approach of diversity, considering
              not only taxonomic diversity but also functional and
              phylogenetic diversities, to study the impact of human
              activity on ecosystems. I’m also interested in developing
              new methodological approaches to better assess ecosystem
              functioning. I have studied different taxa and scales
              which has led me to be more motivated by the research
              question itself rather than by the taxa it applies to.
              I’d love to hear from you, you can find me online using
              the links on the left!

Long-duration remote underwater videos reveal that grazing by fishes is highly variable through time and dominated by non-indigenous species.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
DRIVERS OF MEDITERRANEAN FORESTS TAXONOMIC, FUNCTIONAL AND PHYLOGENETIC DIVERSITY & ITS EVOLUTION ACROSS FUTURE SCENARIOS (Sept 2023 - Sept 2026)
I am beginning a Postdoc at the ECONOVO Center
and Aarhus University (Denmark).
I am studying the relative importance of current and past environmental
conditions and biotic interactions in shaping taxonomic, functional and
phylogenetic diversity patterns. Once this knowledge has been acquired, I will
be focusing on how these diversity facets evolve across different
socio-economical scenarios and assessing species vulnerability to land-use and
climate change.
This work is part of the INTEGRADIV
Biodiversa project.
FUNCTIONAL DIVERSITY OF FISHES IN COASTAL MARINE ECOSYSTEMS AND ITS TEMPORAL VARIABILITY (PhD thesis - 2019 - 2023) 
I did my PhD at the MARBEC lab at the
University of Montpellier (France). I
developped new tools to estimate the temporal variability of fishes diversity
and functional roles based on cameras approaches. Using these tools, I studied
how functional roles varied at within-day and between-day scales in temperate
and tropical coastal ecosystems. Then, I have assessed how this temporal
variation at short temporal scale can affect our perception of Protected Marine Areas
effect. I have found that within-day and between-day variability in species
functional roles is high and that functional processes (such as herbivory or
corallivory) are mainly realised during intense activity events. Thus measuring
functional processes on short temporal scales can biais their estimation.

articles.title: Scientific Events
articles.contents:
Conference talks
2022
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): A new framework based on synchronised cameras to measure fish abundance 
2021
International Symposium on Coral Reefs (ICRS): Tropical exotic fish are key herbivores in the Mediterranean sea 
R Rencontres 2021: Presentation of the mFD package - Recording of the talk here
Co-organised workshops
2022
I had the opportunity to co-organise a Workshop on Functional Rarity and Diversity in Ecology led by the FRB-CESAB and the FREE Research Group. During this workshop, we did a practical on the use of the mFD and the funrar R packages.
Co-organisation with: Matthias Grenié and Sébastien Villéger
Scientific popularization
2022
I participated to the “Ma Thèse en 180 secondes” (Three Minuts Thesis) competition: the goal is to resume the thesis subject in 3 minutes for a non-scientific audience. My colleagues and I had the opportunity to speak in front of about 450 persons, it was an incredible experience! My talk in french here.

articles.title: Teachings
articles.contents:
Teaching is a part of my job that I absolutely love.
Transmitting knowledge, finding new ways to explain key concepts,
and engaging with students also helps me evolve in my research work.
2019 - 2022
Lectures, tutorial groups and practical works (french) for Bachelor and Master
at the University of Montpellier in:
Biology of Organisms
Functional Ecology
Description of data variability
Biostatistics and R coding
2023 - 2025
(coming soon)
